etymologies: late 15th century (as angulated, used chiefly as a botanical or zoological term): from Latin angulatus, past participle of angulare, from angulus ‘angle’. The skiing term dates from the 1970s

definitions: hold, bend, or distort (a part of the body, especially of an animal) so as to form an angle or angles

examples.text: the hindquarters are more strongly angulated than the forequarters

shortDefinitions: hold, bend, or distort part of body so as to form angle or angles

definitions: incline (the upper body) sideways and outward during a turn
shortDefinitions: incline upper body sideways and outwards during turn
